prosperity_details: Creating an end to extreme poverty with the Raha basic income.
trust_details: Unique identity network of trusted individuals built for the sharing economy.
free_details: Raha is for everyone with no cost to join and a democratic evolution.

economy.title: Shared Prosperity with the Raha Economy

income.title: Raha Basic Income
income.text: Verified Raha members receive a Raha Basic Income that is currently 10 Raha points per week. You must periodically claim this income, and can accrue at most 4 weeks of unclaimed basic income.

inactive.title: Inactivity Donations
inactive.text: An account has issued no transactions for 400 days goes inactive and donates its balance to the basic income fund at a rate of 1% per day.

transactions.title: Transaction Donations
transactions.text: Instead of transaction fees, the Raha Network encourages optional donations of 3% of each transaction received to help fund the basic income. For verified members there are no required sender fees for the first 20 transactions a day, and after that it is 0.01 Raha points.

ten_billion.title: Ten Billion Units
ten_billion.text: There are ten billion units known as TBU and initially all belong to the basic income fund. The current exchange rate between TBU and Raha points is 1:1, though this may change to make common denominations of Raha points more user friendly.

invite.title: Invite Bonus
invite.text: While the network is bootstrapping, you may instantly claim 6 weeks of basic income for each new member you refer via video, up to a maximum of 150 members. The Raha Parliament will likely change this bonus amount frequently, and it may one day go to 0.

parliament.title: Raha Parliament
parliament.text1: The Raha Network will evolve frequently over time, and these evolutions will be controlled by the member elected Raha Parliament. The two main responsibilities of the Raha Parliament are changing network parameters and approving budgets.
parliament.text2: For instance, over time the Raha Parliament will have to lower the basic income amount to prevent the fund from running out as there are only ten billion units. The good news is that because of Metcalfe’s Law, more members means a much more valuable network. Even as the basic income decreases in amount, it will likely increase in market value.
parliament.text3: The Raha Parliament will be elected by members of Raha, but the voting system and mechanisms are still under consideration. To participate in the Raha voting system design, please visit the Raha Governance category in the Raha Discourse.

parliament_fund.title: Parliament Fund
parliament_fund.text1: 80% of all raha distributed from the basic income fund goes directly to members, and 20% goes to the member-elected Raha Parliament to fund the long-term growth of the Raha Network.
parliament_fund.text2: The Raha Parliament fund can only be spent after approving a budget, and no budget can be approved until the Raha Parliament exists. The Raha Parliament will not exist until voting has been implemented and its constitution has been written. All spending will be completely transparent via the immutable and distributed Raha audit log.

parliament_budget.title: Parliament Budget
parliament_budget.text: An example budget for how the Raha Parliament’s 20% allotment from the basic income fund might be spent is listed below. Join us on Discourse to advocate for new ideas for the budget, or lay the groundwork for an election campaign so you can join the Raha Parliament and approve budgets yourself!
parliament_budget.point1: 5% for expanding the network to underrepresented demographics in the Raha network.
parliament_budget.point2: 5% to expanding the Raha marketplace and establishing partnership programs to grow Raha adoption.
parliament_budget.point3: 5% Raha Network software development, maintenance, and server costs.
parliament_budget.point4: 5% towards building an endowment to help stabilize the market value of Raha.
